  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After loading the IBC on an outbound trailer, Veolia personnel discovered an approximate 1 gallon release of hydrogen peroxide beneath the container. Investigation of the leak revealed that the bottom outlet valve on the IBC tote leaked due to being in a slightly open position. The valve was closed and cleanup conducted in house. The release impacted the trailer floor and area beneath the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2025051220
item.description:
Report X-2025051220

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor III John Santos contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. John stated forklift operator Alexis Roy was attempting to move a staged pallet containing 5-gallon pails of UN1823, Sodium hydroxide, 8, PG II in Bay 67 for a dock pick-up. John stated that one of the 5-gallon pails broke through the bottom of the pallet. John stated when Alexis attempted to pick up the pallet the one of the blades on the forklift punctured the 5-gallon pail that broke through the bottom of the pallet resulting in a 1-liter spillage on to the forklift blade and the dock floor in Bay 67.

item.title: Report E-2025050402
item.description:
Report E-2025050402

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1:46 AM ET, UDV contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Henderson, CO. The spill consists of approximately 5 pounds of Metso Pentabead 20, which released from 1–50-pound paper bag due to a loading error prior to arrival that left the bag torn on the top corner, spilling onto the trailer floor. ERTS will dispatch for contractor assistance as this is a corrosive powder release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-10 pounds of UN3253 Metso Pentabead 20 product released from a 50-pound paper bag which was located at the top of the pallet which impacted 10’x3’ of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The team vacuumed the loose powder and restacked the product onto a new pallet. The damaged bag was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with debris. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060106
item.description:
Report E-2025060106

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After loading, driver left the shipper and product came from the dome lid area. Dome lid was not fully tightened. Driver failed to ensure protection of the dome lid gasket and the dome lid bolts released from the dome lid causing product to fill the crash box and leak through the drain tubes.
